alert.note: Alert for Lee (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 26 at 8:13PM EDT by NWS Tampa Bay
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Florida, including the following county, Lee. * WHEN...Until 930 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 813 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Myers, San Carlos Park, Villas, Three Oaks, Pine Manor, Cypress Lake, Southwest Florida Airport, McGregor, Harlem Heights, Iona, Fort Myers Villas, Page Park, Whiskey Creek, Estero and Gateway. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
